result.execSummary:
The defendant Javontae R Hunley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1699.09 to Morgan H. joint and several with 15CF2276.
Pay DNA surcharges.
Pay court costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  the Court ordered that all court costs, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court finds defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 3 years of initial confinement.

Consecutive to: with 165 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full-time employment. Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No contact with the victim.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javontae R Hunley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (39 pages) commencing DECEMBER 17, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Javontae R Hunley in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Javontae R Hunley in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called.  Case passed.  Defense proceeds with sentencing. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  8 YEARS with 165 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 3 years of initial confinement.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment 
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- Provide a DNA sample
- no contact with the victim
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1699.09 to Margan H joint and several with 15CF2276
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  the Court ordered that all court costs, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice  and Acknowledgement
Victim Impact Statement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Javontae R Hunley in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Javontae R Hunley in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Javontae R Hunley in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney is new counsel on the case.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Javontae R Hunley in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Javontae R Hunley in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court grants defense request to withdraw as counsel.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to Withdraw as Counsel, received and filed

Defendant Javontae R Hunley in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State and defense are negotiationg.  Defense request for a brief adjournment granted.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Javontae R Hunley in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Javontae R Hunley in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Javontae R Hunley not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for Timothy Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address bail. Arguments heard. Court denied defense motion. All conditions of bail remain the same. Defense just received and offer and requested a status conference date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 07-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javontae R Hunley in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Javontae R Hunley in custody.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Timothy J. Cotter, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Village of Brown Deer Police Dept. Detective Brian Guenette.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.

Due to the co-defendant having lower pending cases in Branch 22, this case will be transferred to Branch 22, Judge Witkowiak.
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  State not prepared to argue bail on today's date.  Defense counsel requests bail hearing on the next court date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22 for bail hearing and scheduling conference.

All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.
Clerk:  jms
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Morgan H. and Martavis P.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Javontae R Hunley in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Javontae R Hunley in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
